Bash(.venvScriptspython.exe -c "
import pymongo

client = pymongo.MongoClient\(''mongodb://localhost:27017''\)
db = client[''job_recommendation'']

# Count all jobs
total_jobs = db.jobs.count_documents\({}\)
print\(f''Total jobs in database: {total_jobs}''\)

# Check job statuses
pipeline = [
    {''$group'': {''_id'': ''$status'', ''count'': {''$sum'': 1}}}
]
statuses = list\(db.jobs.aggregate\(pipeline\)\)
print\(f''Jobs by status:''\)
for s in statuses:
    print\(f''  - {s[""_id""]}: {s[""count""]}''\)

client.close\(\)
")

Bash("c:\\Users\\DaoDuyThong\\StudioProjects\\Recommend Service\\.venv\\Scripts\\python.exe" -c "
import sys
sys.path.insert\(0, r''c:\\Users\\DaoDuyThong\\StudioProjects\\Recommend Service''\)
from recommend_service.database import DatabaseConnection

db = DatabaseConnection\(\)
print\(''Testing connection...''\)
result = db.test_connection\(\)
print\(f''Connection: {result}''\)

if result:
    query = ''''''
        SELECT DISTINCT j.id, j.title, COUNT\(sj.""similarJobId""\) as similar_count
        FROM jobs j
        JOIN similar_jobs sj ON j.id = sj.""jobId""
        WHERE j.status = ''ACTIVE''
        GROUP BY j.id, j.title
        ORDER BY similar_count DESC
        LIMIT 20
    ''''''
    with db.get_cursor\(\) as cursor:
        cursor.execute\(query\)
        jobs = cursor.fetchall\(\)
    
    print\(f''\\nFound {len\(jobs\)} jobs with similar jobs:''\)
    for idx, job in enumerate\(jobs[:10], 1\):
        print\(f''{idx}. {job[""title""][:50]} - {job[""similar_count""]} similar jobs''\)
")

Bash("c:\\Users\\DaoDuyThong\\StudioProjects\\Recommend Service\\.venv\\Scripts\\python.exe" -c "
import sys
import io
sys.stdout = io.TextIOWrapper\(sys.stdout.buffer, encoding=''utf-8'', errors=''replace''\)
sys.path.insert\(0, r''c:\\Users\\DaoDuyThong\\StudioProjects\\Recommend Service''\)
from recommend_service.database import DatabaseConnection

db = DatabaseConnection\(\)
with db.get_cursor\(\) as cursor:
    # Check columns in jobs table
    cursor.execute\(""""""
        SELECT column_name, data_type 
        FROM information_schema.columns 
        WHERE table_name = ''jobs'' 
        ORDER BY ordinal_position
    """"""\)
    cols = cursor.fetchall\(\)
    print\(''Columns in jobs table:''\)
    for c in cols:
        print\(f''  - {c[""column_name""]}: {c[""data_type""]}''\)
")
